parameter.name: parameter
parameter.description:
List of QC parameters to be displayed in the details table. Read the scqc documentation for a list of available QC parameters and the default configuration of scqcv $SEISCOMP_ROOT/etc/defaults/scqcv.cfg for more examples.
Format: "Parameter name : ConfigName"
Example: "delay : delay","spikes count : spike","spikes amplitude : spikeAmplitude". Refer to the parameters by their ConfigName to configure the attributes.

parameter.name: codes
parameter.description:
The list of channel codes to be displayed. List items may contain wildcards and are separated by comma. The list is intersected with all channels configured in inventory.
Examples:
default : display all streams configured by global bindings
default, PF.BON.00.HH? : display default and all HH streams of PF.BON.00

parameter.name: cumulative
parameter.description: Add new streams automatically to the streams configured in streams.codes when waveform QC parameters are provided for these streams.

group.name: streamWidget
group.description: Control the stream widget which opens when clicking on a stream name in the detailed table.

parameter.name: length
parameter.description: Length of data to be displayed.

group.name: score
group.description: Parameters controlling the overall QC score of a station. The score is computed from the valid count parameter of the defined ranges. It is vizualized in the QcOverview.

parameter.name: ranges
parameter.description: Ranges to be considered for forming the score. Set the count parameter om the respective range section for controlling the contribution of this range. The range parameters control the coloring.

group.name: default
group.description:
Default configuration for all QC parameters. The configuration can be extended to each QC parameter by placing "default" with the parameter name in scqcv.cfg. Examples for some QC parameters are given below.
Read the scqc documentation for a list of available QC parameters and the default configuration of scqcv $SEISCOMP_ROOT/etc/defaults/scqcv.cfg for more examples.

parameter.name: ranges
parameter.description: Names of range profile to be considered. The range profiles define the background color table fields depending on the field value. Add the default ranges for which different intervals and the color are configured.

parameter.name: format
parameter.description:
Values are: int, float, percent, timeSpan
Displays raw values if unset.

parameter.name: expire
parameter.description: Default time in seconds, how long a value is displayed in scqcv if no update is received. Setting to 0 means, show value until updated.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: A color defined by the color definitions below.

parameter.name: useAbsoluteValue
parameter.description: Activate to display absolute values (modulus).

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: Possible values: enableStream, disableStream

group.name: range
group.description: Range parameters overriding parameters from the general range section below. Unset values or range profiles undefined here will be inherited from the general range section.

parameter.name: sane
parameter.description: Value interval for range sane

parameter.name: inter
parameter.description: Value interval for range inter

parameter.name: bad
parameter.description: Value interval for range bad

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: Contribution of this range for computing the score. The range must be considered.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: A color defined by the color definitions below.

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: Possible values: enableStream, disableStream

group.name: availability
group.description: Parameters controlling the display of the QC parameter 'availability'

group.name: range
group.description: Range parameters defining default values which can be overridden per QC parameter in the section of this parameter. More ranges can be added by adjusting scqcv.cfg e.g. in @SYSTEMCONFIGDIR@/.

parameter.name: sane
parameter.description: Value interval for range sane.

parameter.name: inter
parameter.description: Value interval for range inter.

parameter.name: bad
parameter.description: Value interval for range bad.

parameter.name: above
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile above.

parameter.name: below
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile below.

parameter.name: delay
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile delay.

parameter.name: latency
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile latency.

parameter.name: timing
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile timing.

parameter.name: unset
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile unset.

parameter.name: r01
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r01.

parameter.name: r02
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r02.

parameter.name: r03
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r03.

parameter.name: r04
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r04.

parameter.name: r05
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r05.

parameter.name: r06
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r06.

parameter.name: r07
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r07.

parameter.name: r08
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r08.

parameter.name: r09
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r09.

parameter.name: r10
parameter.description: Value interval for range profile r10.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: Contribution of this range for computing the score. The range must be considered. The count is also set in [parameter].range.[range profile].count .

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: A color defined by the color definitions below.

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: Possible values: enableStream, disableStream

group.name: color
group.description: Color definitions. More colors can be added by adjusting scqcv.cfg e.g. in @SYSTEMCONFIGDIR@/.

group.name: format
group.description: Format describtions for showing values. The format parameter is defined seprately for earch parameter but the actual format can be adjusted here.

parameter.name: float
parameter.description: Number of decimal values shown for parameters of format float.
